wikipedia_page.main: Andrew Balfour FRIBA (1863 – 2 November 1943) was a Scottish architect.

response: * Andrew Balfour (1863–1943), architect, work including Holmlea Primary School, Glasgow
* Sir Andrew Balfour (1873–1931), medical officer who specialised in tropical medicine
Andrew Balfour (1873–1931) was a Scottish medical administrator and sportsman who played rugby union for Cambridge University.
Andrew Balfour may also refer to:
* Andrew Balfour (1741–1814), 16th of Whitehill, son of Robert Balfour, 4th of Balbirnie
It was built in 1908 from red Dumfriesshire ashlar in a 17th-century domestic style, and the architect was Andrew Balfour.

The church was completed in 1816, to a design by architect James Gillespie Graham of Edinburgh, built near the site of an earlier, 15th-century parish church, the Bishop's Palace, which became the Cathedral Church of both the Roman Catholic and Episcopalian Bishops of Argyll.Dunoon High Kirk at Scotland's Churches Trust In the late 18th century, this building became dilapidated and was demolished, and the stone used to build the current incarnation. It was enlarged in 1834 by David Hamilton of Glasgow. Five years later, the church's tower, which is in three stages, was raised by eight feet. It has a clock, presented by William Campbell, on each of its four sides. In 1909, Andrew Balfour lengthened and widened the church. The 1939 chancel window is by Douglas Hamilton.
